newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea promotes four businesses to chaebol rank.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea promotes four businesses to chaebol rank.

text.p: South Korea has promoted four businesses to the rank of "chaebol", the 30 largest industrial conglomerates in terms of assets, the Fair Trade Commission said on Tuesday.

They are Anam, Keo Pyung, Miwon and Shinho groups, a commission official said. Anam and Keo Pyung grew rapidly last year through investment in high-technology and telecommunications. The other two attained their size through mergers and acquisitions.
Hanbo and Sammi groups were dropped after their steel flagships collapsed earlier this year.
Also replaced were the Byucksan and Kuk Dong groups for reasons of size.

The commission official said the 30 chaebol had 819 affiliates as of Tuesday against 669 units a year earlier. Daewoo were the top four chaebol, accounting for almost half of South Korea's total exports.
Samsung had the most affiliates at 80, up from 55 last year. Hyundai was second at 57 and LG third at 49.
